[SYNTAX]: Overly complex, lengthy sentences may impede readability despite grammatical correctness.
[LEXICON]: Archaic vocabulary/phrasing (e.g., "enlightened and emancipated men of science") could slightly hinder modern fluency.

[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts (e.g., introduction of expert opinions without clear setup).
[STRUCTURE]: Minor disconnects between personal anecdote and analytical exposition.

[SYNTAX]: Occasionally overly complex sentence structures may slightly impede smooth reading flow.

[STRUCTURE]: Mildly abrupt transition to the concluding quote, though thematically consistent.
